rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Selectivity
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Selectivity is a property of a sensor whereby it provides observed values for one or more qualities such that the values of each quality are independent of other qualities in the phenomenon, body, or substance being investigated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: monitors
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: A link between a sensor an the entities or properties it can monitor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Precision
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The closeness of agreement between replicate observations on an unchanged or similar quality value: i.e., a measure of a sensor's ability to consitently reproduce an observation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measurement Property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An identifiable and observable characteristic of a sensor's observations or ability to make observations.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operating Range
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The environmental conditions and characteristics of a system/sensor's normal operating environment. Can be used to specify for example the standard environmental conditions in which the sensor is expected to operate (a Condition with no OperatingProperty), or how the environmental and other operating properties relate: i.e., that the maintenance schedule or power requirements differ according to the conditions.
rdf:Description.dc:source:
skos:broaderMatch 'reference operating condition' [VIM 4.11] http://www.bipm.org/utils/common/documents/jcgm/JCGM_200_2008.pdf
The difference is that here we also allow for qualities that aren't VIM influence quantities [VIM 2.52] - for example, a quantity that alters the power requirements, but doesn't affect the measurement properties - conditions specified in MeasurementCapability should be influence quantities.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has provider
has owner
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: Link between an entity like a service or a device and its owners or providers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Resolution
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The smallest difference in the value of a quality being observed that would result in perceptably different values of observation results.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Device
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An IoT device is a digital entity which bridges between real-world physical entities and the other digital entities of an IoT system. IoT device interacts one or more networks through which interactions are made with other entities. IoT device exposes one or more endpoints by which interactions are made. (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Building space
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An entity used to define the physical spaces of the building. A building space contains devices or building objects.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Frequency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The smallest possible time between one observation and the next.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (ioT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: contains
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A property between a thing and its components. For example, virtual things can contain virtual things while physical things can contain physicial things.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates a value provided by an interaction pattern. In case one ore more values are indicated the order will be defined by the time stamp attributes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has vendor
has producer
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: Link from a device to its vendor or manufacturer or producer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is neighbourhood of
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: A link between a neighbourhood and the specific agent around which the neighbourhood is built.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: hasPartnershipWith
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: A link between two organizations who are in a partnership relation. A partnership is established between organizations, only 2 organizations.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: describes thing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link from a thing description to the thing being described

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Thing description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A digital representation encapsulates a physical object accessible via Web services

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Relative endpoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An endpoint which is relative (its href is composed by a relative path and an absolute one given by another endpoint) to an endpoint which can not be relative.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interacts using
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: Linkg between an agent and the virtual thing it interatcs with.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is described by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Relation from a thing to its thing descriptions

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: service name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of a service

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: describes ecosystem
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link between a thing ecosystem description and the ecosystem being described.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Human user
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A human user is person who uses an IoT system. A human user is a specialization of an IoT-User. A human user interacts across the network via an application. (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Battery Lifetime
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Total useful life of a battery.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Survival Property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An identifiable characteristic that represents the extent of the sensors useful life. Might include for example total battery life or number of recharges, or, for sensors that are used only a fixed number of times, the number of observations that can be made before the sensing capability is depleted.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Latency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The time between a request for an observation and the sensor providing a result.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Maintenance Schedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Schedule of maintenance for a system/sensor in the specified conditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: time stamp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time stamp in which a phenomenon takes place, for example when value has been taken.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Service
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A service is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A Service is offered by a device that wants (a certain set of) its function(s) to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A Service must specify the device that is offering the service, the function(s) to be represented, and the (input and output) parameters necessary to operate the service.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Physical thing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Any entity that has a proper space region.

A physical entity is a real-world thing. A physical entity is a specialization of entity. A physical entity may contain other physical entities. A physical entity is a discrete, identifiable part of the physical environment that is of interest to the user for the completion of her goal. Physical entities can be almost any physical object or environment; from humans or animals to cars; from store or logistics chain items to computers; from electronic appliances to closed or open environments.
(Definition taken from ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA))

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Neighbourhood
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A set of IoT infrastructures and value-added services integrated through a network of VICINITY Nodes, where the infrastructures can share the access to their IoT objects without losing the control over them.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: detection limit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An observed value for which the probability of falsely claiming the absence of a component in a material is Î², given a probability Î± of falsely claiming its presence.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Accuracy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The closeness of agreement between the value of an observation and the true value of the observed quality.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Digital user
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A digital user is a digital entity which uses an IoT system. A digital user is a specialization of an IoT-User. A digital user interacts with one or more services offered by the IoT system across the network. (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Response time
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The time between a (step) change inthe value of an observed quality and a sensor (possibly with specified error) 'settling' on an observed value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: serialNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Device serial number

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sensitivity
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sensitivity is the quotient of the change in a result of sensor and the corresponding change in a value of a quality being observed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has neighbourhood
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: The link between an agent and its neighbourhood. Such neighbourhood will link to all the entities involved in such neighbourhood.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: expressed in format
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link from a value to the data format in which it is expressed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: literal value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Literal representation of the observed value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: System Lifetime
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Total useful life of a sensor/system (expressed as total life since manufacture, time in use, number of operations, etc.).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ecosystem
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Collection of things that co-exist in a given environment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: service description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Natural language description of a service.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has component
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A link between an ecosystem and the things that compose such ecosystem.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: device description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Natural language description of a device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: People counter
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A people counter is a device that is used to measure the number of people traversing a certain passage or entrance. (Definition taken from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People_counter)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Thing ecosystem description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A digital representation that encapsulates an ecosystem taht is accessible via Web services

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Agent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An agent is a person or piece of software involved in a VICINITY neighbourhood.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is ecosystem described by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link from an ecosystem to the thing ecosystem descriptions that provide information about such ecosystem.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Class representing values provided by an interaction pattern in a given time stamp. It might also indicated the data format in which the value is expressed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is involved in
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: A link between an agent and all the neighbouthoods it is involved in.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operating Power Range
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power range in which system/sensor is expected to operate.

An observable Quality of an Event or Object. That is, not a quality of an abstract entity as is also allowed by DUL's Quality, but rather an aspect of an entity that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity and is observable by a sensor.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A ssn:Property is something that is a DUL:Quality and has a ssn:isPropertyOf property who may be a ssn:FeatureOfInterest
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: property (ssn)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Collects together measurement properties (accuracy, range, precision, etc) and the environmental conditions in which those properties hold, representing a specification of a sensor's capability in those conditions.
The conditions specified here are those that affect the measurement properties, while those in OperatingRange represent the sensor's standard operating conditions, including conditions that don't affect the observations.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measurement Capability
rdf:Description.dc:source:
Similar idea to MeasurementCapability in MMI Device Ontology http://marinemetadata.org/community/teams/ontdevices
But the the two express the relationship between constraints and multiple measurement properties differently.
The conditions linked to a MeasurementCapability are skos:exactMatch to 'influence quantity' [VIM 2.52] http://www.bipm.org/utils/common/documents/jcgm/JCGM_200_2008.pdf

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A sensor is a device that detects and responds to some type of input from the physical environment and outputs digital data that can be transmitted over a network. A sensor is a specialization of an IoT device. A sensor monitors a physical entity. The output digital data may only be distantly related to the input from the physical environment and may be output with a significant time delay, depending on processing of the data within the device, for example, the recognition of the identity of a person from a surveillance camera device. (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Survival Range
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The conditions a sensor can be exposed to without damage: i.e., the sensor continues to operate as defined using MeasurementCapability. If, however, the SurvivalRange is exceeded, the sensor is 'damaged' and MeasurementCapability specifications may no longer hold.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: involves
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: A link between a neighbourhood and all the agents involved in it.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is contained in
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between an object and the physical space in which it is located.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operating Property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An identifiable characteristic of the environmental and other conditions in which the sensor is intended to operate. May include power ranges, power sources, standard configurations, attachments and the like.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measurement Range
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The set of values that the sensor can return as the result of an observation under the defined conditions with the defined measurement properties. (If no conditions are specified or the conditions do not specify a range for the observed qualities, the measurement range is to be taken as the condition for the observed qualities.)

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: acts on
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A link between an actuator an the entities or properties upon which it can act.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: desctiption
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General attribute for descriptions assigned to any type of concept

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Actuator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An actuator is a device that accepts digital inputs and which acts on (changes) one or more properties of a physical entity on the basis of those inputs. An actuator is a specialization of an IoT device. An actuator acts on a physical entity. (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: avatar
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A link from an entity to the image identifying it in a social network or system.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is component of
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A link between a thing and the ecosystems it belongs to.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Vicinity core model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This ontology represent the core terms to allow interoperability in an IoT context based on VICINITY technological solutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: device name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of a device

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is relative to
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link from a relative endpoint to the (non relative) endpoint to which it is relative.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Application
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An application is a software entity or system that offers a collection of functions with which a user can perform a task or achieve a business objective. An application typically uses services. The functions of an application may be presented as services. (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Condition
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Used to specify ranges for qualities that act as conditions on a system/sensor's operation. For example, wind speed of 10-60m/s is expressed as a condition linking a quality, wind speed, a unit of measurement, metres per second, and a set of values, 10-60, and may be used as the condition on a MeasurementProperty, for example, to state that a sensor has a particular accuracy in that condition.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Drift
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A, continuous or incremental, change in the reported values of observations over time for an unchanging quality.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (ioT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Virtual thing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A virtual entity is a digital representation of a physical entity, contained within a service. A virtual entity interacts through an endpoint. A virtual entity represents a physical entity.
(Definition taken from ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA))

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: provides
owns
rdf:Description.rdfs:isDefinedBy: A linkd between an agent and the entities, like devices or services, it provides or owns.

rdf:Description.rdfs:seeAlso: ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Service
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A service is a set of distinct capabilities provided by a software component through a defined interface, which may be composed of other services. A service is implemented by one or more components. A service defines network interfaces and exposed by an Endpoint. (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)
